creditline:
The William M. Ladd Collection
Gift of Herschel V. Jones, 1916
text: In 1889, D.Y. Cameron created twenty scenes of the Scottish islands, peninsulas, and areas surrounding the coastal waters of the Firth of Clyde. Here Cameron highlights the Isle of Arran, the largest island in the Firth. William M. Ladd owned all but one of the twenty etchings from this set in early trial printings.
title: Arran
